task.title: Connect GitHub to Netlify
task.shortdesc: This task will show you how to connect a GitHub repository to Netlify.

context.p: Learn how to connect a repository in GitHub to Netlify that will allow you to publish deliverables through Netlify.

step.cmd: Download this repository from GitHub: https://github.com/VT-Evia/partystarter

fig.title: Screen capture of where to download GitHub repository

image.alt: Screen capture with an arrow showing where to download a GitHub repository.

step.cmd: Generate and Copy Site ID from Netlify

substep.cmd: Open Netlify and scroll down to the drag and drop box
Drag and drop the extracted GitHub repository into the box

fig.title: Screen capture of where to upload GitHub repository in Netlify

image.alt: Screen capture with an arrow showing where to place a GitHub repository in Netlify.

substep.cmd: To the right of the site ID, click the "copy" button
